blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Klink Family
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Klink Family
body:
599: Klink

Here’s yet another Pokemon that’s notoriously hated from Gen 5. And my song and dance here is hardly any different. Often sited is the fact that they’re gears, and who would want to make a pet out of gears. To which I say what weakling WOULDN’T want pet sentient gears? They for certain have a unique charm to them with those goofy little faces. They’re just. Cute little gears. I can’t be angry at that!

I also like how even ingame they end up making some silly excuse as to why Klink is even around. It’s acknowledged as a very minor point in the game, but they do bring up the question “where the heck did Klink come from?” To which the best answer you got was “It just showed up one day after the industrial revolution.” Fair enough.

Personal Score: 7.5/10

Fun friends!

600: Klang

If there’s one downer point I’ll bring up about this line, it’s that I do agree with the criticism that little more is done to evolve other than adding more gears to it. But at the same time… what else can be done? It’s a Pokemon emulating parts of a machine. What better way to change it other than adding more parts into that machine? My problem comes in, in that there doesn’t feel like there was that much done with that being the case.

Personal Score: 7.5/10

Nonetheless a good ‘Mon

601: Klinklang

Point is, yeah. It adds about one new part per evolution. I usually really like the gear-filled clockwork aesthetic but even then. Something here feels only half-realized. Not enough to call it half-assed. Maybe more like three-quarters assed. Point is, you tend to notice when a whole quarter of an ass is missing.

Which is sadly what’s keeping this line from getting better scores. I still like them all quite a bit, I was just hoping for some crazy clockwork monster. But instead the end result is a big-but-still-fairly-tame clockwork monster. I think basically, Klinklang would’ve made a good middle-stage that evolves into an even bigger monstrosity made of even more gears! Maybe even incorporate some clock elements to complete a look and give it a feature to set it apart from Klink and this one as a hypothetical “Klang.”

Personal Score: 7.5/10

Not that Klinklang is without its dues, though.

Overall:

I still like them as some out-there monsters. But they could’ve been even more extreme. Maybe one day, a Mega Klinklang can scratch that itch…

[Archive]

[[MORE]]

summary: I watch this Pokemon streamer, SBJ, all the time (he's @pokemonpodcast here on Tumblr) and this was a very funny moment. A...
description:
I watch this Pokemon streamer, SBJ, all the time (he’s @pokemonpodcast here on Tumblr) and this was a very funny moment. A chatter didn’t know what “spooning” was, so he explained with visuals. Soon Jirachi x Slowpoke will be more popular than Skitty x Wailord.

He has a PG stream, so go find him on Twitch at “PKMNcast” and join the shiny hunting fun! He’s starting a playthrough of Alpha Sapphire tomorrow for his birthday stream! 💙🎂 It’s a very friendly and fun community.

blog.name: pmdrestoringthebalance
blog.title: PMD: Restoring the Balance
blog.description:
A Chespin, who was formerly a human, is suddenly thrown into the Pokémon world with little explanation except the knowledge that the world needs saving. Having no memories other than the fact that he was once human, he is one of three Pokémon who were chosen by the legendary Lake Guardians, Azelf, Uxie, and Mesprit, with the intentions that these three heroes will be able to find a way to put a stop to the world's destruction. With many challenges and dangers popping up along the way, these heroes must learn to work together if they wish to save the planet.

Author's Note: I'm extremely happy to finally be posting this comic! In case anyone wanted, my art blog is @kaidacreatorart, and my main blog is @kaidacreator. This is my first webcomic, so I'm pretty new to this and am still learning, so patience is greatly appreciated!

Comic pages will be uploaded once every Monday (hopefully).

summary: Drew another gym leader. Granbull is my fav fairy type so thus I had to draw a trainer that could fully reflect its natural...
caption: Drew another gym leader. Granbull is my fav fairy type so thus I had to draw a trainer that could fully reflect its natural charm. Had to edit his appearance various times since I still can’t get body proportions right and but also because Wulfric exists. Also unsure if Biker is an official occupation, would love everyone’s undivided support on this matter.

summary: I never posted the story of how mr. mime started stalking me. After some update, he started showing up in my room (barely any...
caption: I never posted the story of how mr. mime started stalking me. After some update, he started showing up in my room (barely any Pokémon ever showed up in my room) and I was like WOW isn’t that kinda rare, that was the first. (With the star) after that… he’s been following me lmao. He spawns wherever I go. It also works for my friends, when I’m around and start the game, mr. mime keeps spawning, when I quit the game, they’re gone too. I have like 80+ by now. They barely ever break out I think I only missed like 2. Also I quit playing months ago or I’d probably have way more of this dude. Why is this happening. It also follows me when I leave the city/country (yes I tried) anyway this is the story of my mr. mime curse or blessing I’m not sure, thanks for reading. ✌🏼

summary: Renma Hotate is a battle-hardned clan matriarch who’s been known my many titles such as “The Harpoon of the Hotate Clan” from...
caption:
Renma Hotate

is a battle-hardned clan matriarch who’s been known my many titles such as “The Harpoon of the Hotate Clan” from her followers, “The Deadly Whirlpool” from her enemies, and “Mom” from her… well, her brat kid Remi.

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

title: Dialga - 483

summary: Happy Dunsparce Day, everyone!! I tried to add as many of my sparcefriends as I could before I couldn’t draw anymore! I hope...

Happy Dunsparce Day, everyone!!
I tried to add as many of my sparcefriends as I could before I couldn’t draw anymore!
I hope everyone has an absolutely amazing day!!!

(ft sparces from @waffleshark, @alolandunsparce, @shadowdunsparce, @dandy-daily-dunsparce, @phaazehunter, @dailydunsparce, @leafylitter, @everysinglepheel, @drunksparce, @tired-dunsparce, @neothebean, and @snuddi!!)

This is also my 10,000th post! Thank you for all the love, everyone!

blog.name: pokebiologist
blog.title: Pokémon Biology
blog.description: I'm Theodora, but you can call me Thea! I'm a Battle Girl turned Pokémon Researcher, and I'm excited to share my observations with you. Feel free to ask, submit, request, and share your own findings!

summary: What can you tell me about the proper care and training for the whole turtwig line? Individually if you can, sorry
question: What can you tell me about the proper care and training for the whole turtwig line? Individually if you can, sorry
answer:
Hello! Yes, I have a deep-rooted love for that evolutionary family!

The biggest thing to be aware of is that they each require massive amounts of very fresh water to stay healthy and to grow properly. While Turtwig can’t do anything about it if they aren’t getting enough water (keep an eye on the coloration of their leaves for the first signs of dehydration), Grotle and Torterra and more than capable of crushing fences, hedges, cars, etc. in their quest to find a good source of water. Torterra ranchers often set up circulating irrigation systems that run through filters to conserve water and enclose a decent area for their Torterra to keep as their home base. If it’s not in your budget to install something like that, there are many tutorials online on how to build your own, involving wooden planks, wading pools, and hoses.

As they absorb all that water in order to process their nutrients efficiently, keep their joints flexible, and grow larger, it’s often up to their trainers to make sure nothing is growing out of proportion. In the wild, they have other wild Pokémon to eat excess fruit, and cover enough ground to keep their toenails worn down, but if it’s a Pokémon that travels around in a Poké Ball or doesn’t have a symbiotic buddy, then it is necessary to clip away branches that are not exposed to sunlight, pick fruit before it rots on their bodies, and clear any leaves that may be obstructing their vision. Trimming toenails is necessary for keeping them mobile and happy, which is a process that can be physically exhausting and a little dangerous. It’s much safer with Turtwigs- many trainers make sure the little guys are well used to the toenail trimming process before letting them evolve. And in any case of doubt or need of assistance, most Pokémon Centers offer it as an additional service!

-Thea

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Clayloom Claydol and Breloom fusion Grass/Ground Type Ability: Keen Eye Hidden Ability: Effect Spore Stats: HP - 70, Atk - 120,...
caption:
Clayloom

Claydol and Breloom fusion

Grass/Ground Type

Ability: Keen Eye

Hidden Ability: Effect Spore

Stats: HP - 70, Atk - 120, Def - 100, SpA - 65, SpD - 100, Spe - 95

The All Seeing Pokemon

Sometimes known as the watcher, it can see everything.  It must be careful when using sand-based attacks as its black eyes are very sensitive to dust. It is actually a giant fungus and absorbs nutrients through its feet.

Request for @anawizachu585. I hope you like it.  Oh no.  This thing.  The eyes look like giant tarantula eyes. This thing. Oh boy.  It’s certainly something.
